{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chromosomal translocation 21/21 refers to a rearrangement of genetic material between chromosome 21s. Down syndrome, also known as trisomy 21, is caused by the presence of an extra copy of chromosome 21. In this case, since both chromosome 21s are involved in the translocation, there is no extra copy of chromosome 21 present. Therefore, the risk of Down syndrome in the child is 0%.", "answer_choice": "B. 0%"}
